He is a very good professor that knows alot about the subjects he teaches( took 2 courses from him ). The material is not entirely hard but there is a lot of topics he covers and any of it is fair game for the midterm/final. Him doing slides is the most efficient way of communicating that info. You're in college stop complaining about slides.

Very difficult, but extremely useful course on programming.   Professor Dillencourt gave a great tour of the world of Algorithms.  Do the homework, go to lecture, pay very close attention to the notes and what is emphasized in class.  Midterms are more than fair.  Final is a bit on the tough side.

Took for Intro to OS class. Reads straight off the power points and sometimes gets lost in his own slides and forgets what he's talking about... In the end I just stopped going to class and read from the book. Grade improved grately.
Algorithms is a difficult class, but Dillencourt adequately prepares you for the majority of the grade(~90%) midterm + final. He is extremely knowledgeable about the subjet matter, smart dude.

He has two grading systems, one with a pintos project, one without. He will take the highest grade of either. He had 4 quizzes and 1 final. Honestly a good class to understand about Operating System. I loved it and I like his lectures as they are interactive. Take him!!! Final and quizzes were based on his slides.

Enthusiastic and passionate lecturer. Lecture can be a bit dry, but they are super informative and Professor tries his best to be engaging and ask questions. Homeworks, exams and quizzes are extremely easy so long as you paid attention during lecture.

He doesn't deserve a rating as low as he has currently. He's one of the best UCI professors I've had and his class got me into hardware programming. However, to people not interested in low-level or hardware programming I can see why his lectures might seem dry. I would highly recommend taking his class if you are interested in these topics though.

CS143A: 4 written-type HW based on lectures (ample time to complete them), 1 midterm, 1 final. There is also an optional programming project in pintos. He posts the slides but going to lecture is important to understand them (since HW and tests test understanding). Average lecturer, pacing is good. Recommending having a friend to compare homework.

Really fair professor. Tests are honestly not that hard. The material is also pretty easy if you actually go to lecture. He explains things in a way that's easy to understand, and always asks if anyone has questions. The projects are pretty hard but I didn't do the final project and still got a B+

Got below average for the midterm in this class. +3% curve, but still a C. Worked really hard to do the Pintos project (this is very difficult, do start early), and came regularly to class. Did extremely well in the finals, and overall grades curved by 10%. Received an overall grade of 99.75%. Don't give up :)

He is very good about explaining things, very clear. There are 4 HWs (easy), 1 Midterm (Easy, questions similar to HW), Project (HARD, 10% of grade, average was F on this assignment), and Final (40%, very hard, they must've graded this generously because I should've gotten a 40/100 on it, got way higher). Ended the course with a 10% curve

Extra credit on hw to get students to 100% in that category. Although I did well on the exams, they were extremely difficult. Be sure to study everything. He is very clear when explaining things in lecture but there's hundreds of slides so its very difficult to remember every single detail. He heavily curved the class, no complaints there.

Lectures are incredibly dry and dull.  Tests are either more difficult versions of the homework questions, or obscure question types not mentioned in lecture or homework - possibly from the book, not sure didn't read it.  Gave opportunity for extra credit on any homework questions missed, and replaced the midterm grade with final grade.

His lectures are an endless wave of facts that you just have to absorb. He explains each thing pretty well by itself, but doesn't tie things together. Tests and homework are fine. Lectures are worth going to for the explanations, since the slides are pretty confusing and need explanation to make sense. He knows his stuff and can explain if aske

He's very knowledgeable + passionate about Operating Systems. With that said, he's not that engaging of a lecturer. Lecture was mainly worth going to when he went over examples. Discussions were helpful and one of the TAs this quarter was really awesome. Incredibly difficult class. Tests were really hard, and the homeworks could be difficult as wel
Not very good. Accent, not engaging or interesting

Nice professor. He is one of those professors who is genuinely passionate about algorithms, and in this class it shows by the way he teaches. Super chill class if you are interested in algorithms. We had 3 main coding projects and 3 reports per project, analyzing the algorithms you implemented. Very cool and unique class. No final or exams.

Overall, super great experience. Professor Goodrich is very good at making complicated subjects simpler in his lectures. Homeworks were really difficult, but exams were fair for the most part. Anyone who enjoys algorithms should definitely take the class.

Goodrich has been one of my favorite professors at UCI so far. It is great seeing a professor who cares about students learning, and you can tell he genuinely wants the students to have the same passion for the material as he does. The course itself is easy but leaves room to make the most of it if you choose to.
Chill class. Three projects throughout the quarter. It was cool to see the visualization of algorithms. Highly recommend this class. Did you know Goodrich is the Goat?

CS 164 is a great course that is more useful than I expected and really challenged my abilities. The course is graded on relatively easy quizzes, very difficult homeworks, and relatively straightforward exams. The course really revolves around Berg's comp geo book, but lectures are solid. Goodrich is good, but only take 164 if you like math/algos.

Goodrich is one of the best professors I've had at UCI. Lectures are concise and Goodrich is very engaging. The content of this course is very difficult if, like me, you aren't an algorithms person. Weekly homeworks require some extrapolation from the lectures, but are graded leniently and only 20% of the grade. Quizzes and exams are very fair.

Gives very vague lectures that introduce the topic for the week. Then the homework is extremely involved and advanced, and the tiny amount of content he taught is useless. End up learning everything online on your own. Grading of assignments also takes week so you go many weeks without feedback or knowing what your grade is. Class was still easy A

CS 164 is an utterly useless class for 99% of CS majors, and Goodrich doesn't make it any easier. The only upside when I took him is that he got rid of finals/midterms because of COVID-19 making it an online class. The HW was 70% of the grade, quizzes 30%, both I had to Google to get any points out of. Don't take this class OR this professor.

His 1st time teaching 165. Pretty relaxed class, just 3 individual projects. The sizes of the projects aren't that large either, not as much as expected for DS&A class. Requirements were ambiguous and the TA was a bit unclear with setting requirements/grading rubrics. Goodrich himself is pretty passionate about algorithms.

This class was very chill. There were only 3 projects. There were a handful of challenging bits of code, but the projects boiled down to: copy pseudocode from slides into C++ code, plot results using numpy/matplotlib, and write a report on it with some log/power math stuff. For me, it was the easiest project course out of cs 117, 122b, 175, and 125

Prof doesn't care about the class. Comes and lectures once a week and leaves project guidelines up to the TA, who also doesn't care. The projects are written extremely poorly, and ambiguities are cleared up 2 days before their deadline if we're lucky. You're not gonna learn in this class bc of how stupid and useless the concepts taught are.

Cool guy with not much workload. Weekly hw of 5 questions, some of which were totally impossible to figure out. 2 exams and final. Wasn't sure how to prepare for exam1 and did awful, but exam2 and final went a lot better. Class gets easier once you get the hang of it, all the algorithms have the same flow. Very mathy class. Take after 161 and LAlg

Professor Goodrich is fun, charismatic, and so obviously in love with the subject he teaches. He makes a course, which is typically full of theory and proof-driven concepts, palatable to even those who are not familiar with theoretical computer science. Weekly homeworks are straightforward and exams are easy aside from 1 or 2 challenging questions.

Too many thins in one quarter. Lectures are confused. Homeworks are super difficult and you will never get the correct cause he won't post it. The midterm sample is not hard, but the real midterm is really hard. Same for final. Get ready to learn by yourself outside of lecture.

Horrible professor. The worst I have had so far! He does not use a textbook so you must pay attention in class. This would not be so bad except that he moves very fast. It is very difficult to jot down his cryptic notes in time and even harder to do this while following the actual meaning. He jumps around the board and avoids answering questions.

Franz is very cocky and unresponsive. not available in office hours. the quizes have nothing to do with lectures. All you have to know is writting grammars and recursive descent parsers. projects are easy if you're good in java

Class was terrible. Material was ok and Franz just breezed through it. Quizes were easy but thats because TA gave us more of the answers beforehand. Projects are killer though requiring all nighters because they change the requirements and code almost daily. Avoid!
Very helpful in class. Labs are pretty easy; he provides most of the code needed for the labs and a lot of testing code. You will learn a lot and feel much more confident about compilers.

Really good professor. Explains course concepts very clearly and easily. Lectures will help a lot. They are also really good and will help you a lot. Homework is light work. Biggest downside tho is bad organization. Professor was very busy this quarter and couldn't teach 3 lectures. HWs were released late at times. Class is easy so its not too bad.

The professor is very chill and understanding in teaching this course. The grade is determined by a few online quizzes and Arduino labs that have clear directions/aren't too hard. Lectures are very interesting and a bit theoretical as he talks about ML + IoT applications a lot, but overall fun class.

This is the professor that I think is the one who really understands all of the concepts in logical design. His lecture is the best for me so far. No need to do extra practice. Attend the lecture, and you will understand everything. Finally, get a satisfying grade.

Worst educator I've ever encountered. Made us proofread his own unpublished/unfinished book as a mandatory grade. Left the ENTIRE final project's information blank so we all just designed our own final project. Also did not offer any recorded lectures for students affected by COVID. Left all his work for the students and TAs to do. Do NOT take!
Knows how to teach - always reviews previous material and highlights any links when covering new ground.

Professor Baldi is one of the smartest people you'll ever meet. I first had him for 6D,  and I was very impressed. He will make you work hard but it's worth it.  I had him again for CS 172b, deep learning with neural networks, which is part of his research focus.  The class was less work than his 6D class but harder content. My fav class so far.

Aditi is one of my favorite professors. She's a very passionate lecturer, and her assignments are great learning material. This was one of the most useful courses I've taken in my time - it's difficult without prior graphics programming knowledge, but it's well worth the trouble.

Usually don't like giving low scores but CS 111 was so bad. Lecture videos jumped right into mathematical formulas without any context. Each lecture video was so long and unclear, it felt like I was supposed to already know half the things we talked about. Prof might have tried her best, but I eventually dropped the class. So rough...

Had her for two classes in the same quarter and they were both by far the worst classes I've taken at UCI. Lectures are convoluted and not helpful, using advanced jargon and syntax that you will have no idea about unless you've taken a previous course which is not a prereq. Expect midterm and final questions on topics never discussed in class.
Lecture and textbook are poorly explained. Just throw a lot of formula without explanation.

You are required to go to lectures after watching her posted videos. The midterm had things she never talked about or only briefly mentioned. TA was supposed to teach us how to do the homework but instead told us to look up tutorials online because that is how previous TAs had done it. Her book had errors the TA had to correct. Her notes are messy.
Loved the class! Would definitely take another course offered by her.

Yeeeeeaaaa no. Don't take. Unfair quizzes. Long-winded projects. No instruction. She doesn't teach you how to apply these really abstract topics, so this class is basically "How to feel terrible 'cause you've been left in the dark 101." She is horrendously (almost hilariously) bad. Oh and if your major requires this, change your major or good luck.

I'm keeping it real. This is the worst class I've taken in my life (I'm a senior by the way so I have experience). No help. No instructions for assignments. She comes late to class and exams. She doesn't plan in advance. She skips class days. Office hours are required if you want a D or higher. Avoid this professor at all costs.
Avoid at all cost or prepare to take a hit to your GPA

If you're successful in this course, it will be despite Professor Majumder, not because of her. She's terrible. She's antagonistic, hostile, and rude. The projects in her course are poorly constructed and genuinely useless. Her written assignments are cryptic and bizarre. The exams are overly difficult and graded harshly. Avoid at all costs.
She doesn't care about teaching and it shows. Feels like she is trying to avoid teaching the class.
Repeatedly missed class and asked students to come in at odd times to make it up. Very rude.

Computer graphics... Sounds like fun?? Sure!! But only until the day she starts teaching it to you... Don't take her if you don't have to. If you are reading this and you value your grades avoid her at all costs. Just put it this way, I would take Hirschberg over her any day.
Bad teacher that expects students to do well on extremely hard exams. Her slides are horrible. You'll do okay if you manage to pay attention in class, otherwise don't expect to rely on the textbook.
This guy is the sole reason I went to grad school, and a truly inspirational person. You'll work your butt off, but it'll be worth it.
Makes you pay for a textbook written by him. If you are able to learn fine asynchronously/self-paced you'll do well, but I did not retain anything from this course.

It's asynchronous, online textbook, reading, small activities, and hw problems. I spent about 3-4 hours on this class per week. (2-3 hours reading+activity and 1-2 hours hw). You get what you want out this class. You can learn or not learn if you want. Either way you'll get through the class fine.
You should take this class if you have the chance

Fall 2024. Lectures were the same as textbook (must buy to do activities for canvas grade). Homework is zybook exercises, either super easy problems or tedious busywork, with some problems having no hint on what to do or requires a specific formula not covered in the book. Midterm & Final had easy problems or a curveball. Grade based on exams.

well this class is just a zybook and the zybook itself is mostly terrible. All homeworks are zybook exercises which would be fine but the reading is useless for the homework. Most hws consist of long busywork problems that you wont learn from. Luckily hw is graded on participation. Entire grade is based on the two canvas exams.
Unfortunately no matter how much to try in this class if you mess up on the final you are going to fail! I emailed him more than 3 times, and never got a response back!

His lectures are pre-recorded, and heavily based on the zybooks that we need to pay to use for just one quarter. His lectures are just reading through some slides and playing animation in the zybooks, all topics are very conceptual, no examples are provided to help us understand.
Excellent short videos to learn the material. Homework is really helpful to get a better understanding of material. I loved this class and his teaching!

Grade is 2 projects that he gives you at beginning of quarter and all the material needed to complete them. Professor releases test cases on day project is due and you have until midnight to submit on time.

Online class. Midterm 35%, final 35%, zybook reading and homework 30%. Read a chapter zybook and do homework each week. Open note but you need to understand the concepts/homework problems to implement them on test. Did not learn much, little contact from prof, take this class just for the grade. Not too difficult of an upper div.

EASIEST CLASS OF MY LIFE. Class is only graded by 2 projects. The instructions for both of them are on his online textbook which he gives you access to a week before class. HIGHLY RECOMMEND doing both of the projects before the class starts or during week 1. You just need to check them w the test cases he reveals the days they are due.

Homework every week and you have to pay for his textbook. His lectures is just reading from the book and the homework is much harder than the examples he gives. Concepts before midterm were easier, but after midterm was much more difficult. He will only curve to have certain amount of people for each letter grade, so not everyone will get a curve

Easiest CS upper div by far. Two projects which you can do in Python. It's operating systems but the projects are so high-level that you don't need to understand anything conceptually. Didn't learn anything. Look for test cases from previous quarters. My advice, do both projects at the start of the quarter before you get stressed by other classes.

It was basically a two week class stretched over ten weeks. In Fall 2020, I had the process manager and virtual memory project. The process manager was like your lower-div assignment but way less workload and difficulty. The only hard part about the virtual memory project was the specification. I finished it in one day after I understood it.

Most boring class. It's an easy class to pass, seriously just take him if you have to or don't care about the content. You won't learn anything from his ZyBook. Waste of money, avoid this class if you care about your education.

2 projects, 40% each. Knowledge checks is 20%. You have to buy his book ($45) to complete the knowledge check. His book and presentation for the second project was poorly explained. Projects have a lot of test case to consider.

The grading scheme is 80% for two projects, and 20% for the online textbook questions. You can use any language on the projects and they aren't difficult. The project instructions aren't very clear, but Bic is very active on Piazza to clear up confusion. 143B isn't officially an online class, but it's basically an online class.

Easiest class at UCI. Two projects each at 40%, you are given 5 weeks to complete both projects but you can complete both in a day or two. He also introduced an online textbook the quarter I took him, where you have two sets of knowledge checks each worth 10% of your grade. Highly recommend, if you want an easy project course.

Online easy project course. 2 projects: Process Manager and Virtual Memory. You get a month to do each in any programming language you want. He gives you everything you need to finish the project at the start, so you can finish at your own pace. And the projects are simple, I finished project 2 in 3 days and never had to worry about it again.
Low rating for making me buy his book. Book was literally a copy and paste of his lecture slides.

Homework was given twice a week, but this was during summer session. Graded for completion. Have to read the zybook which can be kinda hard to understand sometimes but his video lectures give some useful information in order to understand. Midterm and Final were not cumulative and were done as Canvas quizzes with ProctorU.
AWESOME. I personally think that most on-campus classes are a waste of time, and I wish every class were like this course.

Quizzes were hard no matter how much you study, and they were multiple choice check off several boxes style. Always trick questions. Grading was extremely harsh. Final is open note so he makes it ridiculously hard. Records his lectures and posts online, awful and not useful. Shame that convenience of 5 week summer online class is ruined by this guy

Lectures are like drinking out of a fire hose. Non stop information overload. he makes mistakes and uses terms that are not synonymous interchangeably. He is not that great at explaining the concepts and sometimes confuses himself. Book he uses sucks (he wrote in 2002) He does give a generous curve though. Id still take him over Klefstad or Pattis

I took CS143A with Bic through an online class during thesummer. His lectures are very clear. It is encouraged to take notes. It was very helpful that the quizzes and final are open notes. His curve is generous; I got a B+ and got it curved to an A after acing the final and doing average on the quizzes.

Two project online class. A File System and a Virtual Memory manager. These two projects account for your whole grade. At the time I took this class he gave us a around a month each to complete the project. It took me around a week to do each project which goes to show how simple they are. Just give yourself a enough time and you'll do well :)

I don't recommend taking this class with Dutt unless you're okay with self-learning the textbook. Boring lectures, poor communication, non-existent study guides, 3 midterms with bad point distributions, lots of grading mishaps, 4 labs (lab 3 is difficult!), and a CURVE DOWN at the end. Dutt said he makes the average either a C- (hello???) or B-. :(
Most uncoordinated, inconsistent class I have ever taken. Save your sanity and do not pursue Dutt.

Dutt's lectures are organized and clear. He explains the concepts well and doesn't stammer. Zybooks was used. We had Weekly quizzes, that made up a big portion of our grade, and two basic Verilog Projects. Final was cumulative. Take Dutt without a doubt, as he rarely teaches. (151 only in Fall with him so don't miss it)

He's alright. His grading criteria is mostly based off of his quizzes and exams. BE sure to read and study well because if you screw up on his quizzes a lot, you're gonna face the consequences. His final was harder than I expected

An average professor teaching an average class. This upper division course teaches the same content as CSE 31. The content it self is fairly easy and can be learned through reading the suggested textbook and the assigned online textbook.  Grade was based on 4 quizzes and a final. The course website has 10 years of past quizzes/exams to study from.

The key to taking CS 151 with Dutt is figuring out how to study for the quizzes. First, the quizzes are made by the TA and they will closely follow (sometimes be the same) as the sample quizzes provided by the course site. Same goes for the final. Lectures are pretty much useless. TA Discussions are much more useful. This class is really hard.

He had 7 quizzes (which meant he didn't teach those days)and he took days out of town which were listed on this syllabus in advance.  He taught a total of 13/25 lectures.  His lectures are from the book.  He tries to go through the material as quickly as possible.  He had his TA make the quizzes, midterm, and final.  He doesn't care about his class
Horrible lecture, Unorganized, Only read textbook and unclear writing.
please never ever take this professor or class, he's so boring, homework is long and super tedious for no reason, his average rating is 1.3 and median rating is 1 for a reason lmao

DO NOT! I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. The lecturer is very dry and is just math proofing heavy based. Under graduate workload and graduate student workload is similar. Exams are difficult and there are 4 individual HW due every week that will take you HOURS to do. There's a final project to do in addition.

Writes a bunch of gibberish proofs on a paper and calls it a done lecture after an hour and 20 minutes of absolute garbage. His Zooms last time had 2 other people joining out of 100+ students. He's easy but you don't learn anything. He should lose his job. All he does is stroke his ego about how he worked for NASA. Big deal!

The book isn't required, you'll want it if you want any hope of understanding. The labs are taken from another professor which help guide you through the coding, he adds an extra problem at the end and gives no guidance. Worst teacher I have EVER had, no one knows what is going on. Just does proofs all lecture and expects you to remember them all
He doesnt know what he is teaching
Not good at all, unfortunately. Extremely boring lectures.

This guy's lectures consist of just VERY unclear proofs of methods of optimizations; methods that we need to code ourselves for HW. The 1st half was the hardest class I've experienced at UCI. 2nd half was SO chill. Class was half undergrad students, and half grads. HARD midterm (compute proofs), then the rest of the quarter was a final project.

He uses an assemblage of slides taken from other professors and doesn't post them online. Very poor speaker and isn't prepared to lecture (decides during class which slides and bullet points he wants to read; takes him a few moments to understand the info on slides). Worst Prof I've ever had. Do yourself a favor and take this with someone else.

Honestly, the most stressful part about this class is going to lecture and watching him write calculus proofs all day. But other than that, the course is not too bad; the subject matter is interesting, homework assignments are fun (with lots of EC)... and no final exam! Beware of the midterm however; it's all proofs, though grading seems lenient.

He doesn't use a clear lecture method for project classes and tends to play it by ear. On the other hand, he doesn't require you to learn anything specific, won't "test" you, and will be happy as long as you demonstrate that you learned SOMETHING in the subject during your time with him. Great to take for project classes; not so great for math.
terrible teacher. He assigns too much work. Lots of HWs and projects. Final was very vague. He can't teach. Avoid at all cost
exams are insanely difficult but hws are fair

lectures are thorough but not necessarily engaging, so her slides are enough to understand and complete the content of the course. disc attendance is "mandatory" but its counted based on completing the gradescope quiz at your corresponding disc time, although one of which we didn't learn its content in class one time. the 2nd exam (final) was hard

The class is very boring she repeats the same slide 10 times, and then they don't appear on the final or midterm. And she doesn't provide final grades so it goes into transcript last day, so you can't even complain.horrible don't take her you will learn 0%

Roth is eh, there are 6 HW and 2 tests (one midterm and one final). Her HW has a good amount of mistakes are kinda of vague but very responsive on Ed. Overall tho, all of the HW is very doable. Her midterm was fairly easy and was very similar to the sample midterm, but the final was something else. She allows a one-page cheat sheet for both tests.

She overcomplicates concepts, youtube taught me better. Sample midterms and endterms give you a false hope for the real tests which has material that you wont have any opportunity to practice on. Soulless lectures. Homeworks were actually fine. Quizzes were participatory, but will not prepare you for the tests.

Best I can describe class with Roth is average. Go to lecture, take notes, do the homework and you'll do well. Her lectures aren't the most riveting experiences, but she goes over everything you need to know for the tests and about the material in general. HWs can be vague so start early and post on Ed, but her exams are more than fair.

I'm taking her 122d class and this is the worst s*** I have ever taken in my life! She gave a final to us where there was no partial credit, and TAs are just like her, they don't know and will not help you.
You're better off learning from YT than attending her lectures. The homework assignments are vague AF.
One of the worst professors. Her lectures are dry af. She just reads off of slides. One of the worst lecturers ever.
I'm sorry. What's this?

The midterm was a nightmare, the final was less of a nightmare but still a bad dream. After the midterm, everyone agreed that it was the hardest exam anyone had ever taken. She never submitted the final exam scores to deliberately not curve the final. She also went no-contact when multiple students inquired about their scores.

This professor is very unprofessional and assigned homeworks that were unnecessarily difficult and not representative of the exams. The exams were not similar to the practice exams whatsoever and were extremely hard. On top of that the questions were very confusing and the format as well (you have to take it on your laptop in class). Avoid!!!

very poorly structured class, exams were extremely difficult and not representative of what was on the study guide or hw. she had to have a ec exam bc of the low averages. that being said the professor was very nice!
(she does not teach)

If someone ask me if this class worth to take it? Then I would say no.
You learn all by yourself. I guess SQL youtuber is your professor.
Only a few examples that are not related to the exam.
Reading the slides during lecture with the same tone.
Does not answer clearly. Always the vague answer.
SUCH A WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY.
She answered some questions about the final example sample wrong, and copied and pasted questions from a past Berkeley exam in our midterm. Clearly has no prepare to be a professor. Take Wong-Ma.

if youre being paid to teach can you actually teach & NOT give vague answers to our questions, vague instructions to the homework prompts, stick to an actual schedule, not talk about your neighbors, and write readable slides (and not just 160pages+ slideshows that have one change per slide) (why do i have to play where's waldo with your slides????)

SHE DOES NOT TRY TO TEACH.
When students ask, she doesn't give clear answers. She would just say, did this in the class/discussion. Students asking questions because NONE of them were helpful. Her lecture is just reading off from the slides, MY BIGGEST WASTED TIME. 
Hello? can you at least TRY to be helpful to students who are willing to learn?
Has anybody counted how many neighbors she has??

Professor Roth is not a good professor. She just reads off her lecture slides and she does nothing to make them interesting. I essentially had to teach the material to myself from the slides, since she does not do a good job explaining the material. I highly would recommend any other professor for this class.

i dont know how to explain this but i am such a hater. previous prof's midterms were open cheat sheet, open book, open web, open mysql, and shes like "closed note closed book no partial credit, write your queries on a pdf" ......

you ever look at someone and wonder what is going ON inside their head? its this class bc nobody knows wtf is going on. i went to ta session not only did he not show up he corrected me on a question i had then sent me an email the next morning saying "nvm, actually i had it wrong". my partner went to 2 and they gave her conflicting info be so fr rn

wk 1-3: hw0/1 setting up mysql + drawing an er diagram
wk 4: hw2 p1: figure out random fds' decomposition that wasnt taught in class; translate hw1 er diagram into relations, then write sql 
wk 5 midterm practice midterm did not resemble actual midterm at all
week 6 hw3: relational algebra w multiple discrepancies in btwn prompt doc/autograder
1/?

Roth is very knowledgable & clearly cares about student's learning. However, she does not have much experience with giving lectures which causes them to be a bit wordy and boring (though the slides themselves are very useful and the hw she gives is helpful as well). Essentially, not a great lecturer but smart, caring, and will improve with time.

You learn everything off of slideshows. That's it. There are no videos or group activities. Every class is her reading off the slideshow word for word. She claims to have worked with famous and smart people, so she has impressive experience, but she is NOT a good teacher. A 3rd grader can do her job since they can read and speak off of a slideshow.

I go every lecture, they're still pretty useless (you can genuinely learn more if you just use the notes). Not sure if she has previous teaching experiences but I regret taking this class with a guest lecturer. Grading is also very nebulous and strict, I'm not always sure how they grade us. Prof is v well educated but def not really an educator.

The lectures are literally useless. You learn more by reading the slides on your own. Homework assignments are so hard and unclear with very few instructions. You have to figure out everything on your own because she never gives clear answers. She answers our questions as if we already know the material. It has been a mentally draining experience.
You learn about her famous neighbors and colleagues, useless and boring lectures.

3 Lab Projects and 2 homework. Homework were doable if you read the book and watched youtube all day. You're going to have to pray for a good TA, the book won't help you on the project. Prof is very unresponsive and when he is, he might make you feel dumb for asking the question. If you can avoid him please do.

Seems like a nice guy but boring lecturer. Homework was very frustrating since a lot of the questions were poorly worded. Professor failed to mention that we needed a specific version of the textbook until after many people had bought an earlier edition. Overall the class was not necessarily hard or a lot of work but felt rather disorganized.

The class is very interesting itself, but the professor provides little to no help. Labs were do-able with the help of the TA and discussion sections. Final was tough and counted for 40% of the grade. There is no test format to go off of since there are no midterms or quizzes. Overall, I really enjoyed the material learned, but just from the book.

plain boring explanations. not very prepared on the topic he teaches, used to deflect questions with vague answers (e.g. I don't use windows, i don't know how to do that; I am not up-to-date with Java so I don't know). After 30 years or so teaching DS, I would expect a  knowledgeable professor able to transmit passion to students, he is def not.
I took a bunch of courses taught by this guy... looking back at my undergrad degree, i kick myself for wasting time with him when there were so many other great courses and profs.
Loved his history review it was so helpful. Was super stonebreaker.

Great Professor, responsive on Ed, incredibly nice and an enthusiastic lecturer. As a class, slides are a bit dense and content is dry imo. 

Needs more Stonebraker.

Great professor. Really cares for his students and helps a lot through Ed and his office hours. Homework assignments were difficult and take more time than expected. I really enjoyed his class. However, because TAs went on strike, class became disorganized towards the end. He really tried to be accommodating and helpful to students. Curve at end.

Hard professor but interesting content. There is a lot of conceptual stuff weeks 1-6 and cram of SQL the last 3 weeks. I think should be other way around we focus more on SQL then conceptual. Homework is very hard doable if you understand content fully. Can work with a partner. Exams are toughs and TA make the grading a little easier than he does.
I'm paying $20k/year for this?
The best professor at UCI
stonebreaker
He cares for his students and always helps them learn
Stonebraker
Loving his class. Great professor in all respects. Very engaging and challenging.

I was not sure going in but i really enjoyed the course. The lectures were amazing and i learnt a lot, Be ready to work hard on assignments though. The exam, while not easy, was fair and you will do well if you attended classes and did assignments.
I was not sure if I wanted to take this course. So glad I did. I love his lectures. Now I want a career in databases.
I took his course 5 years ago. My favorite prof. at UCI

Syntax on slides was sometimes incorrect. Group assignments doable, but annoying since we had to teach ourselves a lot of stuff. Lectures boring, and tended to snag on students' questions, which he would take time to answer. Textbook unneeded. Provides practice tests that help a decent amount with studying. Below-average professor.

respectful lecturer, it would be much helpful if one of the discussions was dedicated to prepare us on the journey we were going to take regarding the projects one after another, he generously curved the class.

Prof. Mehrotra loves to teach and his lectures were a lot of fun. The assignments were not hard, but a lot of work. Assignments are done in groups, so choose your group wisely. Exams were much easier and based on the notes. He did not use the book much.
This class was a tragedy. Never in my life did I think these would be the worst 2 hours of my life. I'm not just talking about the midterm and final. I'm also talking about his crazy lectures.

Lectures are useless. Show up to discussions, you learn the most there. Groups are mandatory for projects and are worth more than the midterm; they go very in-depth compared to the lecture slides, so expect to Google everything. Midterm/final were hard, but the curve is fat. Tl;dr show up to discussions, learn from Youtube, pray for a fat curve.

I don't typically complain about teachers, most learning happens outside of class anyway, but this professor makes it nearly impossible to learn in class. His thick accent coupled with the scant coverage of MySQL and poor availability of resources to learn the stuff make this class, an annoying pain. Take 122a with a different professor.
I loved this prof. He can be fast-paced and you will need to work before class to not fall behind. If you put in the effort you will learn a lot. Midterm was fair. Waiting for finals tomorrow.

He does not care about his students at all. Introduces 4 dense topics a week before finals. Lecture notes incoherent. Lectures incoherent. Assignment specifications a mess. Do not take if you possible.
Dunno why the person below me rated him so highly. Mehrotra is garbage. Class is disorganized and every week felt like torture.

7 group hw assignments, 1 midterm and 1 final. The hw assignments will take up a few hours per week, the exams are hard but doable if you keep up with the hw and watch youtube videos. Mehrotra curves at the end of the class. Lectures can be confusing if you fall behind, so it's best to just watch youtube videos at home that teach the same thing.
Don't even bother with this professor. Typos everywhere, class is horribly structured, in an INTRO class he tries his best to shove so much information down your throat. Avoid at all costs.

tests are stupid with no partial credit on short answers, assigns stuff that are significantly harder than what he teaches, can't understand him, lectures put me to sleep, tl;dr he sucks avoid at all costs

There are typos everywhere, which have impeded learning. Typos on the lecture slides and homework make it confusing whether or not we are learning accurate material. Studying the quizzes and practice midterms will not be sufficient because you will be NOT tested on the material you were given to study, but you WILL be tested on irrelevant material.
just avoid this professor for this particular course. it's a hot mess.
this class is so disorganized, the class is an information dump on your brain, everyone is a clueless in the class, forced to work in groups, lecture slides are complicated and hard to digest

Mehrotra's lectures were confusing. Luckily the lecture slides are helpful. Grading on the first project was kinda subjective. Lectures were a little boring. Go to discussion if you want to succeed. Midterm and final were curved, but were also still difficult. All projects were group, and you keep the same group. Didn't use textbook at all.

Exams difficult and awkwardly worded, with little partial credit. Assignments are long and time-consuming, and required to work in groups (making it even more time-consuming). TAs were responsive but frequently gave confusing responses. Need to attend lecture; textbook is supplementary at best. Prof is friendly and mostly a good lecturer.
I enjoyed the class and found the professor to be knowledgeable and helpful. The TA was ok, but not great

His lectures are boring, no communication with the TAs, and unflexible. Throughout the quarter all i heard were questions being answered with questions. If there were errors he didn't update the error or notify the whole classing causing people to lose points. Staff is full of negligence and don't care about you or how they are doing.

Easily the worst professor I have had at UCI. One week before the final he regarded the midterm and lowered students scores. Lecture note examples are not compatible with the version of SQL that he requires the assignments done in, making the lectures worthless and requiring you to teach everything to yourself. Extremely disrespectful to the TAs
I am taking the course this quarter and really enjoying it.

This is not a bad class by any stretch of the imagination. In fact, SQL is a very good language to learn. However, prepare yourself for a bit of a grind. The first assignments can take A WHILE. However, they ease up a bit as the quarter progresses. The tests aren't necessarily hard, but they can be a tad confusing. Make sure you study up for them.

The biggest problem I have with Professor Mehrotra is that his slides are so outdated, most of the SQL found in them no longer work. That aside, the class is fairly challenging and covers a lot of material. His lectures can be a bit boring, but he tries his best to get his students involved in learning and will slow down whenever anyone asks him.

He is not clear when lecturing, and his PPT presentations have a ridiculously large amount of slides. Lectures are purely unbearable. The assignments tend to be much more difficult than what we learn in lecture, and grading is subjective.
Wow! What a great professor... I learned so much from him and I was not interested in his topic either. Love his class!!
Excellent teacher  very helpful amongst the best at UCI

Teaches about a very difficult topic (SQL).  He is hard to listen to (has an accent) and always talks about the little details.  I felt he never gave a good "big picture" view of what we were doing.  Because of this, I never cared about what he was talking about and found it hard to see how different topics connect together.
Took the summer version. Awesome professor. Knows a lot and communicates clearly. Four homeworks and two take home midterms. He almost solves everything in class ! I learned so much.

No exams, grade entirely determined by 8 homeworks. Some were difficult but he would spend entire class periods answering questions and trying to get us to understand the material, which made attendance essential. He was lax and let us colab with as many people as we wanted. Funny and intelligent, cares for students. Code and math heavy class

This is the RISC class. Uses the typical Patterson and Hennessy book. Four homeworks and two take home exams. Professor distributes transparencies (no need to take notes). Spends lots of time explaining assignments and exams. Does not provide solutions, but with all the discussions and explanations, assignments and exams should be a breeze.

He taught this class this one time and will not teach it again. The other professor was on sabbatical. His lectures were engaging and interesting. I did not miss a single one. He is knowledgeable and knows how to keep us interested and attentive. Graded on the basis of 8 assignments only. Reasonable amount of work for a fair grade.
Probably the best professor in ICS at UCI. Helpful and accessible. Makes you work but will not let you fail. Will help you personally if you fall behind. Compassionate. A fantastic human being.

In my opinion, Dr. Scherson is an incredible professor. He really loves what he does. He is not interested in making you suffer or fail, but in leaving something in you. He said, "Let's have fun in this class, and if it is possible, we will learn something". I definitely recommend his classes.

Great professor. Reachable, helpful, and explains each concepts clearly. The course covers the basics of RISC processor. After the quarter, you will clearly understand how the single processor is working. The course consists of two take-home exams and 4 HWs. He goes over exams and HWs during class, so it's very easy.

Great professor. He wants students to understand the fundamental concepts.  I really like how he draws circuits on the board and approaches the problem step by step. Exams are open "everything"(even laptops). The problems aren't tricky. But they all require you to understand what's going on. I didn't miss a single lecture, his jokes are hilarious.

Easily one of the best professors at UC Irvine. Prof Scherson is incredibly intelligent and he will randomly go on tangents during lectures to teach you a fun little fact. He really cares about his students and he will pick on everyone to make sure they learn the topics well. The homeworks are long but incredibly useful. Easy class as well.
Easily one of the greatest professors at UCI.

My god. This is the best teacher I've taken in my history at UCI and is better than any professor I remember. He inspires your passions about system architecture, explains detailed complex systems clearly and easily, makes the class IMPOSSIBLE to fail if you show up and try hard (he says at the beginning of class he doesn't fail anyone). Best ever.
He is difficult and his class does demand a lot of time spent. However, you learn a lot if you pay attention. Plus his usually gives his finals the week before finals week.
Amazing class. Learn new DB languages. Grade is mostly homework. Enjoyed going to lectures. Highly recommend 122D.

A worthwhile class to get exposure to DB technologies beyond CS122A. The homework deals with different DB languages, and it's honestly fun. Low(er) stakes midterm and final - since it is a project course, most of the grade is from the HW assignments. Lectures are a bit dry, but prof definitely knows what he's teaching & encourages asking questions.

Taken online in Spring 2021. Lowkey a lot of work, you learn a new software for each assignment (PostgreSQL, Spark, Cassandra, Neo4J, etc..) and then answer SQL problems (which are pretty fun tbh). Tests are kinda hard and have a bunch of those A, B, C, Both A and B, Both B and C type questions and like 'draw out the result table for this query'

He is honestly a GREAT professor, unfortunately, I just couldn't get excited about the material. He definitely puts a lot of effort into his courses and is very informative and goes over great examples in class and tries his best to make the course interesting, but it just wasn't my kind of material. Still, a very useful course and learned TONS :-)

Carey is a decent professor, but his lectures are boring. Also he likes putting weird/hard questions on his tests, and that kinda hurt my grade. However, he explains things pretty well, and is very responsive on Piazza. He's probably a better choice than most professors, but I've definitely had better.

Very good professor, highly recommend! Good powerpoints slide, extremely knowledgeable, good at lecturing, caring, puts in attention to the homework assignments, is super active on Piazza, and clearly enjoys teaching. I wish more CS professors were like Carey.

One of the better upper-div professors at UCI; while some find his lectures dry, he does a good job of explaining concepts and is very accessible via Piazza. The homework assignments have become more difficult than previous ones, but they do a great job of ensuring that you learn the material thoroughly. Exams can be fairly difficult/tricky.
Exams are tough but doable if you pay attention to lectures. He covers everything thoroughly. Also very active on piazza and kind of sassy (but funny)

Good class. Very organized and responsive. Assignments, exams, and material were all challenging but doable. Cons: the exams seem to change from quarter to quarter so they can be unpredictable. And his lectures were hella dry; all of em felt like the longest 50 minutes of my life. Overall fair, a good balance of feasible and challenging
He made the class way harder for the online quarter. All homework and tests are more difficult than previous years.

Made an account specifically for this professor. In my 4th year at UCI, this professor was the first one I've made this review for. In his lectures he's extremely clear and makes everything so easy to understand. It's clear he cares about his students and wants to make sure everyone succeeds and focuses making sure his students learn.

Solid professor, clear lecture and responsive on piazza. For difficulty wise, homework are more difficult than previous quarters but the midterms are a bit easier and doable. You also actually learn a ton.

Prof Carey has really done well at curating this class, everything was very streamlined and there were no hiccups. His lectures were very informative, albeit long, and if you take the time you will be very successful in his class. There were no surprises on the midterms, and it felt like he really cared about his students. 10/10 would take again.

Difficulty kind of ramped up near the halfway point. Midterm 2 was rough. You need to take some time to practice writing queries to get good at them. But he's a pleasant guy, really quick to respond on Piazza. Overall, the class isn't bad, just keep up w the lecs and hw

One of the best classes I have taken at UCI. He is super sweet and caring about the students and he is incredibly responsive on Piazza. The TA's were also superstars this quarter since everything was online. The grading was extremely clear and so were the lectures. If you have the chance, take this class.
He is the GOAT! Super responsive on Piazza!

Prof. Carey is amazing during the online quarter. Seriously, he IS the top professor here. Beware that this class is not as easy as some people say, you still need to understand everything from lectures. For those who hate to listen to lectures, you are in big trouble. Take his classes NOWWW because he will retire after Spring 2023!
THIS MAN IS A BEAAAAAST. He is so caring and present. Literally average response time was 11 minutes. like b r u h. 10/10 fellow and if u gave him less than a 4, check yourself lmao

Best teacher at UCI hands down. He cares so much his students and genuinely wants them to learn the material and understand it. Responds to almost every single Piazza question, and didn't have any issues the whole quarter with class logistics. His midterm 2 was difficult, but he listened to student input and made the next one easier. 10/10 :-)

He is an extremely caring professor, and genuinely wants his students to do well. He is also very accommodating and will curve the second midterm if he thinks it wasn't fair. He has a good sense of humor and really encourages his students to learn and discuss with each other. As long as you dedicate time and effort to the homework, you'll do well.

Mike Carey is hands down one of the best teachers that I've ever had. His lectures are extremely clear with content and relates directly to homework. Even though there are weekly homeworks, weekly quizzes, and three midterms (last one is the the final), this class is definitely doable and you'll actually feel like you're learning and feel progress.

- This class feels like a less intense version of Pattis' class. - Great at explaining topics without putting you to sleep. - VERY responsive on Piazza - There is homework and a mini quiz due every week. - Stuff we learn is pretty relevant
He is one of the best professor I had ever met.

He is a caring professor but his lectures are very dry and boring, so you are on your own. The exams difficulty keep changing because apparently he is still experimenting with the class.  There is a curve but its not a fair one so dont count on it. I wouldnt recommend taking him.

Really nice and it seems like he cares a lot about the subject and students. Positive experience with the professor. On a side note, the material is tricky regardless of who you take it with but it's doable.

Carey is very knowledgeable and thoughtful during lectures. Weekly homework is manageable with a lot of resources to get help. The first midterm was easy while the second one was hard. Beyond lectures, he's very caring and understanding when it comes to the concerns of the students. Easy/moderate class overall, would recommend.

Carey is definitely a caring professor and all-around friendly & knowledgable guy. Lectures are a on the dry side. Homeworks are fair but do require some self-learning, and exams are also fair, though get harder as the course goes on. Definitely learned a lot about databases.

Carey is a great professor and just a great person overall. His lectures are pretty informative, and he organizes the class really well. 3 midterms (no cumulative final), weekly participation quizzes, and weekly homework. Class is very formulaic, and if you study and have any interest in the subject you will do fine. Nice curve too.

To start off, Carey is one of the most eloquent, caring, and involved professors I've ever had. He really does try his best to help out all students in understanding the course material. However, sometimes lectures can be very dense, due to the material itself, especially in the latter half of the quarter. 3 midterms, 8 HW assignments in total.

Before I start, Carey is very smart and an excellent guy - he is also very helpful and always responds fast on piazza. HOWEVER, his lectures are very boring, hard to follow along since examples are already done on ppt. The homeworks are hard and require a lot of self-studying, and the exams were extremely difficult to an unfair extent.

Very knowledgable, nice, and articulate guy. Explains material OK, but lectures are pretty dry as he just goes through a bunch of slides. Exams are inconsistent in difficulty. Must learn on your own to do the HW, which are however worth a hefty portion of the grade.

Professor is extremely intelligent, caring, and respected. However, as others have said below, this class is a lot harder than you think. The HW takes HOURS. The exams are not easy. A lot of material is covered in a short amount of time. Graders are really tough, never had assignments/exams graded so harsh before.
He makes my brain hurt.
Bad lecturer

Loved taking him! Honestly I only got a B+ because I skipped one of the assignments entirely, but it was amazing having him Winter 2017. I really recommend going to lectures too, though they can be slightly hard to follow, but felt worthwhile. He have us free quiz credit for going one of the late Friday lectures.

Best professor I've ever had! However, he got HARDER over the years. Exams aren't easy anymore and you definitely have to study for them. Homework is also REALLY hard - so expect to spend hours and hours doing them. But he is a VERY kind professor, explains the material flawlessly and clearly, and always responds to Piazza posts within one day.

Pretty laid back. As long as you pay attention in lecture and follow along you should understand the concepts. Midterms/finals okay since allowed cheatsheets. Very nice and interacts with students regularly. Seems like she genuinely wants to help students learn. Prettiness is almost distracting during lecture. Reminds me of Cameron Diaz's cousin.
S. Tauro is better with CS141, 142 than with any other courses. She's very clear in explaining compiler. Projects are intense, quizzes are very helpful for the tests.
Good teacher, wants you to learn but material is hard.  Projects get hard after the second one.  Gives quizzes randomly worth 1 or 2 points. If you're lazy don't take her.

Took this class in the summer..was not easier unfortunately. Gave us quizzes based on information we were introduced to only a few minutes before. After the 1st 2 projects, it gets somewhat hard. Does not provide much info/help with using languages like Haskell, Prolog, and Perl. Tests were alright, you get a cheat sheet for both final and midterm.

Great teacher. the class was a bit hard and i definitely had to do a lot of work, but if you put in the effort, you will definitely be awarded with a great grade. tauro is clear an if concise and makes classes fun. she gives credit to those you attend class so go! easy points!

Whoever says this woman is attractive needs to go outside more. Her class is insanely difficult for a subject you will never use again. Her style of teaching is pure ****. Quizzes you on subjects she has shown for maybe 5 minutes. Programming is on par with (literally) a project course. Can have tons of hw. Help is limited or none. Don't take her.
shes cute. plus, her class arent bad. in terms of work, if you know what you are doing it is very minimum. i can't believe she didnt get a chilli pepper.

I've had her for CS 51, 141a and 142a. I think Tauro is an excellent and fair professor, and most of the hate on here comes from people who are frustrated with the difficulty of the material and looking for someone to blame. I'll admit I felt like this at first, then I got my act together. CS isn't an easy major, deal with it.

Taken her for 3 classes previously (hated it). Surprisingly, CS142a wasn't bad at all. Supplied test cases for the projects makes debugging easy. Book isn't needed. Quizzes help keep you on track, and aren't worth much. Attendance is crucial. Midterms not that bad (get cheat sheets =]) and no final.

Tauro tends to use common everyday words to describe complicated concepts, a welcome change from most CS professors that use incomprehensible technical terms. Don't waste your money on textbooks for Tauro's classes, she goes out of her way to test you on lecture material. It may take some time getting used to her high school lecturing style.
ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE! Word prof EVER! AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Very bad instructor. She does not tell students what she expects and tries to trick them. Her projects are very poorly written up. She includes little to no instructions on what she expects. She is very smug when she is approached for help. Avoid this instructor at all costs.
wow i should have taken this class with franz... tauro's 6 pages of negative reviews speak for themselves... it is very dificult to guess what she wants us to accomplish with our lab assingments...
Is it really so much to ask that you make sure the assignments you're giving us are correct? I don't think I've ever had a lazier teacher.

It felt like I was back in highschool again, which that was a major dissapointment. Her lecture wasn't a lecture. She made students participate 90% percent of the time. I'm here to listen to her and not students. I got annoyed the fact that she made fill-in-the-blank lecture slides. I paid good money to go here. The subject is not bad, it's her.

Intersting class, wasn't terribly hard. Took me 5 hours for each assignment/homework at most. Sample code had poor-style which encouraged the use of your own code. Lectures are mandatory by use of quizzes. Shannon didn't make the course easier, but certianly didn't make it harder. It was 'just right' in my opinion. Put in the effort & you'll get an

I've taken 3 classes with her. Only because I did not have other choice. Her Projects are really annoying. Really many bugs and coding style is worse with not enough explanation. You have to figure out by yourself what she was thinking when she was writing the assignment. YES, it's not an easy class. BUT SHE MAKES IT HARDER. Avoid at all cost.

Alright as a human being, but her course was awful. The material was uninteresting, the lectures were boring, and the homework assignments did *very* little to reinforce your understanding of the core concepts; they more or less gave you something to do. Being in a university that so often touts the prestige of its CS dept, I'm pretty disappointed.

Class boils down to time & willingness to attend OH
Attend OH/lec, communicate with prof? hw = easy, will be well prepared & learn alot
Do not do those things or have another class that demands your time (ICS 53)? this class may not fit
Grading is lenient, lots of EC (do it)
Tip: Study the recommended textbook to really grasp the material in depth

Lectures are mediocre, tests and HW are difficult, and the start of the quarter was rocky quality-wise. The second half of the quarter was much better as Panageas hit his stride. As stated below, he is much better during office hours. However, Panageas is dedicated to helping students and is a very kind and charming guy if you get to know him.

Panageas is honestly a decent professor and very lenient with grading. He also gives out very generous extra credit (10%). His lecturing needs improvement though. Also, his office hours are useful. The exams are hard but kinda similar to the homework. The final was harder than the midterms and had a very low average. Overall, an OK professor!

Cares about his students, lenient grading, tests are like homework. However, lectures don't often cover material well enough for homework especially for the first 5 weeks. Additionally, the first five weeks lecture quality was poor and you may have to rely on Abdul Bari. If you want to pass, office hours are great and he will often reveal answers.

I had my doubts about Panageas coming into this class but I'm glad I stuck with him for 161 because his grading and teaching is relatively reasonable compared to other ICS professors. He gave up to 10% extra credit and on top of that a curve which definitely helped raise my grade. Also, ATTEND OFFICE HOURS BECAUSE THAT WILL HELP YOU SO MUCH ON HW.

It's tough material, and I do think Panageas does his best. Lectures are hard to follow, exams are hard (and 75% of grade), homework is harder (24%). He goes over both in office hours if you can make it. If you have bad TAs, expect to teach yourself. Do the extra credit if you want to pass. Lenient grader for the most part.

Professor cares for his student and is nice but he is lacking in the classroom. The lectures aren't beneficial and didn't contribute much to my learning. He just reads off the slides and it feels like an audiobook version of his lecture. The majority of my learning was done outside of the classroom or on youtube. Avoid if possible and take shindler

He's a good professor. Very lenient and cares about students. Honestly, his exams were not hard, at least for your typical algorithms course. His lectures are straightforward and simple, which I really liked. Also super accessible outside of class.

Professor is nice and does care, but lectures were not helpful and he did not prepare us properly for homeworks or exams. Discussions are hit or miss, and office hours are very helpful. I recommend Shindler if you can take him.

I want nuance, but char limit. Pros: Ioannis is honestly a nice guy; he does want you to succeed. Gives healthy EC opportunities. Main Con: Method of teaching during lectures is very lackluster, forcing students to get help from non-lecture sources (TA/YouTube/Office Hours) and require more time than should be needed for a 4 unit course.

Panageas doesn't know how to teach a class. He reads off slides for an hour, and when he does decide to write things down for the class, it's on the whiteboard with barely readable markers or on MS Paint. The TAs are the best resources for learning in this course. Most of your learning will be done on Google or in discussions.

His lectures are honestly not great, but that's probably because of how little time he has for the amount of topics he has to cover. He however does go more into depth during his office hours. He also gives a lot of homework help during these office hours. He gives practice problems for midterms which is very similar to the actual midterm. 10% EC.

This class puts a lot of responsibility on you. You have to force yourself through the lecture, go to office hours, go to discussions, and do the extra credit for a chance to do well. Nothing is clear and at times this class is painful. Only recommend it if you want the challenge.
He gives little to no test review and inadequately prepares us for his homework assignments.

This is totally a scammed, do not trust anyone who rated him more than 1. Bro does not know the definition of "TEACH", the only redemption will be from the TA. BTW, if you got a bad TA, be ready to drop the class. Expect a lecture with only answer without any explanation

This professor is an absolute rock star. The content is very difficult to get down (especially once you're at max flow and later), but he does his absolute best to clarify and explain everything. The TAs were extremely helpful as well. Grading always felt very fair, and the homework and lecture problems do a great job at preparing you for the tests
Great lecture and friendly professor and TA. Just remember to do the extra credit. It is easy and a huge part of the grade.

Great professor. The class is conceptually hard, though the workload isn't bad. Four homework assignments with 2 midterms and a final. Lots of EC opportunities with no reason not to do it. Lectures can be a bit complex but going to discussion is the best way to clear it up. He cares about his students and is very helpful in office hours.
He is honestly one of the best professors I have had at this school. Yannis is super friendly and easy-going, and his class was super poggers. 10/10 would take again
Super chill and friendly professor. Office hours were very helpful! Put in the work to understand homework problems and go through slides and you should be fine.
Yannis and our TA, Will, made me want to go to grad school. 10/5 would take again.

He is a very good professor and as long as you do all the work you will come out better for having taken this class. Be sure not to slack off because the homework and tests are very challenging but as long as you do your best the extra credit he offers can really carry your grade.

Coming into Professor Panageas' class I had depression and lack of self confidence. After taking his class everything has changed. I now feel confident in my Algorithm skills and am not depressed anymore. He is Thorton tier level of a professor. He is a prodigy, all I can do is recommend him because he will change your life. Going to miss his class

His lectures were great, the most engaging ones I have had at UCI. He teaches a lot of information and really cares that his students learn. Office hours are super clutch and he is very helpful. It was his first time teaching the course but he was very flexible and was very eager to hear feedback. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to learn. GOAT

Professor Panageas was one of the best CS professor that I have ever worked with in UCI. His lecture slides were well developed. I am recommending this class to the people who have uncertain ideas about algorithms. If you take this class go to his office hours for sure! Also discussion sections were nice. His TAs was caring and helping a lot.

Incredible Instructor. I wish other professors implemented his method of teaching. His lectures, slides, homework, and projects are the most engaging I've ever seen. The topics are very difficult to understand but he presents the material in the best way possible. He's a PhD student but he'd be a fantastic professor.
Wow best class I've ever taken. This professor is the best at ICS! She teaches her own work so she provides the intuition of the creator. MUST TAKE PROFESSOR!!

For this project course we give presentations to the class.  She is incredibly inconsiderate and cuts people off in the middle of explaining and condescendingly tells the student it makes no sense... but this is because she cuts them off before finishing their explanation and because her English is not good.

Her homework questions are vague.  At one point she changed the syllabus to accomodate a homework she stole off of another UCI professors website.  She can't teach.  The coding project she assigned was too large.  Knowledgeable... but that's her only appealing attribute.

Burtsev is super nice, often pushing deadlines for quizzes & hw projects when asked. He's not out to give bad grades; he understands that the course is hard, so he aims to give a good picture of xv6 without you needing to concern about the grade too much (also gives plenty EC opportunities anyway). Challenging material but really great prof!

I suspect that this class did not adapt well to covid taking everything online. Lectures are so long and dense that they only waste everyone's time. Since the subject matter of this class is somewhat niche, there aren't many resources online to help with assignments. Having friends to deliberate on assignments was the only way any of us did well.

Very kind and accommodating, moves deadlines and offers extra credit. Can be a little sassy and kind of dropped the ball on the last assignment (autograder and criteria were not correct until a couple days before deadline), but overall a great class. Take ICS53 first, it will make this class much easier.

He's an amazing and caring professor. One of the best at UCI. He records his lectures and gives a lot of extra credit. He doesn't like grades and cares more about you learning. HW is 60%, Midterm 15%, and Final 25%. I failed both the midterm and the final, but got an A- in the class cuz of the extra credit plus the curve at the end.

Other CS professors? That's cute. This man has singlehandedly restored my faith in education. He believes more in learning than in grades. His homeworks are fun and are what's most important in this class. Please take him if you can.

This is a difficult course, and one of the most worthwhile ones I've ever taken. Burtsev's lectures and assignments are great and force you to engage with the (inherently very challenging) content, but at the same time there's so much extra credit and so many second chances that you can do so without having to worry about your grade too much.

Prof Burtsev is a breath of fresh air at UCI where most professors don't show any care for their students. Prof Burtsev really wants to make sure everyone learns something and is a little more prepared to work in the real world in operating systems. The material is very challenging. It's a lot of work, but very rewarding with prof Burstev. 10/10

Professor Burtsev is a real gem in the CS department. Historically the exams are difficult, but they are open notes/book/laptop. You learn a lot from the homework, and he offers a lot of extra credit. His mentality is that students shouldn't care about the grade and instead care more about learning the material in great detail. Highly recommend him

He's a very nice man and you can tell he knows a lot. However, he has trouble conveying ideas sometimes and operating systems are pretty complicated in the first place. You're graded by 4 homeworks (60% of your grade), a midterm, and final. All of the homeworks were a struggle for me. Without piazza I couldn't do it. But I did learn a lot.
VERY HARD CLASS! THE PROFESSOR IS NICE, BUT THIS CLASS IS SO HARD THAT HE CANNOT EXPLAIN IT CONCEPTS WELL. THIS CLASS TAKES ME TRIPLE THE TIME I NEED FOR OTHER CS CLASSES!

The midterm(11.87/35 avg) and finals(30/80 avg) were extremely hard but scores are curved. You should take this class if you think you are ready to fail. Exams were open book/note/Internet access. The professor is very passionate about teaching. He cares about students and records lecture slides.

-Def knew his stuff. Cared students were understanding it. RECORDS LECTURES & I learned ALOT on OSs thru recordings so ty -Material is hard if you barely know OSs. HWs were hard but lectures/disc/piazza/office hours helped! Exams were hard af (33% avg on exams) but were open book & curve was great -do read readings & attend/watch lectures!!

The class was hard for me. I had trouble understanding the concepts but the professor repeats things to make sure students understand. He cares and wants to keep improving the class. He provides recordings of lecture. Reading the provided book is helpful. HWs weren't long but took me awhile to get started / understand. Exams test for understanding.

Grade was made up of 4 projects, all of which used coding languages and technologies that were never discussed in the lectures. Final project was completely open-ended and again not something the lectures prepared the class for at all. So the biggest assignments used things that had to be self-taught and were completely unrelated to lectures.

Grades were based on 3 solo projects and 1 group project My complaint is he decided to cut extra credit points down to 1/4 of what they were originally worth (from 5.8% possible extra credit down to 1.45%), and the extra credit influenced the curve down after the final, resulting in a 6% grade disparity, all on the last day with no heads up.

"Extra credit" is factored into the final curve? So extra credit was a lie and oops it's mandatory now. Okay, we have our "extra credit" so this should be our final grade? Nah, the extra credit that's now "mandatory" is now only worth 25% of what he said originally it was worth. Also let me curve down the entire class 5 more %. Run for the hills.

This class was so unnecessarily difficult, and to top it all off he decided to curve the final grades DOWN. Avoid this professor and avoid the whole CGS major because of him- what an absolute nightmare.

This is one of the worst professors I have ever had. His lectures are about high level math while the projects are about coding. He does not teach you how to code at all so be ready to read and self teach the entire time. It seems like he leaves it to the TA's to answer the millions of questions the students have while he does nothing. DO NOT TAKE!
not very hard, TA are nice
Math is hard, project is easy
He gives a nice lecture and clear instructions for homework and project. The only thing is that you need to read the book for that test and that's. So it is not THAT easy as my friends told me

Four projects, a midterm, and a final project. Lectures are high level, hard to follow mathematical theory. Projects are low level javascript/webgl (PS: he never teaches about either of these or how to use them). Midterm avg was a fail. Every project was a guessing game. Just a really bad experience.
Did not learn much of anything. Hard midterm not based on anything useful. Final makes you learn the entireity of WebGL bby yourself. Not fun

If you take 112 with Zhao, be prepared to teach yourself everything. Zhao teaches at such a high level that the homework is near-impossible to complete. And don't get me started on the midterm. How to use WebGL was never explained. Your only chance is to do tons of reading from online resources like WebGL Fundamentals and learnopengl.

This was the most time I've spent on a class in my entire degree. The course was very disorganized and the professor was not very accommodating. The meat of this class is reading graduate level papers and using those concepts for group projects. The topics were interesting, but I cannot recommend taking the course.

WARNING: THIS IS NOT THE MINECRAFT AI CLASS ANY MORE. Don't make the same mistake I did, the professor changed it to Adversarial AI and the class is a logistical mess. Now you're expected to read and implement grad-level papers for projects while the professor posts low-quality glitchy lecture videos. No feedback, no grades at the ends of finals.

This whole class is a trainwreck. It'c composed of 3 adversarial ml projects where he expects you to learn the concepts from advanced online papers. The server that ranked students' submissions had constant outages and bugs that made it impossible to focus on the material. It's the end of the quarter and we haven't gotten any grades back.

Most of our grade is how well we do against others on the project leaderboards. He doesn't teach much beyond the basics of adversarial attacks and defenses (only few of lectures over quarter) and expects us to read and implement PhD level papers in pyro. Haven't gotten any grades back yet since the beginning of quarter and it's finals week now.

Class is great if you want to work on a AI/ML project with your own hands. Professor is very easy to talk to and responsive. He gives useful feedback for how to proceed with your project or what to fix. Also very generous with late days. Make sure you form a good team you get along well with and can be productive with.

Fun class, machine learning with Minecraft. Singh introduces some concepts at the first few weeks of class and assigns some simple assignments with Minecraft Malmo and then lets you break into groups and work on the project. He's easy on grading and for the most part is just interested in the creativity of your project

Do the labs (actually do them) and make sure to understand what's going on. They are long, but not difficult. If you understand the labs, you'll be fine on the quizzes. The labs are essentially just applying 132's concepts, but if you forgot 132, she goes over them in lecture.

She is a really nice professor and explains material very carefully in class. If you dont go the lectures, you are not gonna pass on the exams. TBH, exams are tricky in some ways she may ask you questions you never thought of when you are reviewing. Two labs are very important. If you keep high grade on Labs, you are gonna be fine on the grade.

Very hard class BUT she curved A LOT. I got a 50% total in the class based on the two quizzes and final, but I got a B. She says doing lab assignments is enough, but it isn't.  I just did lab assignments and got a B, so not bad. My advice is to do those closer to the tests to remember better during quizzes. Study sample final, even for quizzes!

The grade of this class is constructed by 25% first in lab quiz, 35% second in lab quiz, 40% final. The lecture is so specific to the details and they are almost irrelevant to the in lab quizzes. Every in lab quiz covers three labs, but there's no answer for the labs.   The avg of in lab quiz 1 is 21.7/50 and I only got 6.5  :(
